intro: Orthocarpus sonomensis, commonly known as the Sonoma orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to California, specifically found in the Sonoma County region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
